oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Painting Fit for a Princess
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: n/a, n/a
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Internationally known Welsh artistEric Peake was honored April 11 , 1989by having his original water colorpainting of a pair of Princess of WalesAustralian Parakeets presented by theN.E. Zoological Society to the realPrincess Diana, H.R.H . Princess ofWales.Peake often lends his support to U.S .specialty societies. Last year he painteda pair of Spix's Macaws for the Societyof Parrot Breeders and Exhibitors.The Spix's Macaw print was the firstof a series depicting severely enangeredspecies. Proceeds from salesof the prints went to help fundavicultural projects (see ad, Watchbird,June/July '89, page 59).This same concern for the welfareof living species has inspired Peake tohelp AFA's annual convention rafflesand special fund raisers by donatingbeautiful framed prints.Peake will be at the AFA Phoenixconvention this August. His work willbe available there. It is also regularlyavailable through Corporate Environments,this issue, see ad on page 20.
